title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <vmassol> has quit  
00:47 <abusenius> has quit  
00:50 <Lyes1> has quit  
01:05 <Orson> has joined #xwiki  
01:06 <Orson> Hi!  
01:07 <Orson> I was wondering if there is a way to manually activate a user's account (bypass email verification) on xwiki enterprise 6.1?  
02:08 <OSIMasson> has quit  
02:11 <sdumitriu> Orson: Yes there is, edit that user's profile in the object editor, and switch the Active property  
02:20 <Orson> Ooh that worked!  
02:21 <Orson> Thanks!  
02:36 <Orson> has quit

10:21 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Lyes1> has quit  
10:25 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <drbignik> Hi all. Im trying to fix a problem with dates and different timezones in xwiki-oldcore. I've found 2 classes: DateProperty and DateClass. But i need a user object to get his date and properly convert it to UTC. Where can i find some validation and/or sanitization methods which have the context?  
10:34 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Lyes> has quit  
10:41 <cjd> Good morning, can someone tell me where I would find the "original definition" of xwiki-configuration-resources  
10:43 <vmassol> cjd: what is xwiki-configuration-resources?  
10:43 <cjd> <artifactId>maven-remote-resources-plugin</artifactId>  
10:43 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources  
10:43 <vmassol> ?  
10:43 <cjd> <id>xwiki-configuration-resources</id>  
10:44 <vmassol> doesn't ring a bell  
10:44 <vmassol> where is this?  
10:44 <vmassol> an id is just an id  
10:44 <cjd> yeah, there's nothing else in the <plugin> except for the name and ID  
10:44 <vmassol> for a maven execution I guess  
10:44 <vmassol> you make up the id  
10:44 <cjd> ok  
10:44 <vmassol> what you can do  
10:44 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <vmassol> is search in all pom.xml for other configs using that id  
10:45 <vmassol> if you wish to see what happens when this <execution> executes  
10:45 <cjd> ashh   ../xwiki-trunks/xwiki-manager/xwiki-manager-web/pom.xml  
10:45 <cjd> \*ahh  
10:46 <cjd> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/blob/master/xwiki-manager-web/pom.xml#L107  
10:46 <Lyes1> has quit  
10:46 <cjd> hmm maybe the configuration for maven-remote-resources-plugin is in a parent pom  
10:48 <vmassol> cjd: if you wish to understand <execution>: http://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-default-execution-ids.html  
10:49 <cjd> well.. I kind of latched on to the execution because it's the only piece of data in that <plugin> block so I assumed it was important  
10:49 <cjd> I can't see anything else which directs the action of the plugin to (in this case) grab the xwiki.cfg  
10:51 <AFKGeek> has quit  
10:51 <tmortagne> cjd: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/pom.xml#L187  
10:51 <Lyes> has quit  
10:52 <cjd> thanks tmortagne  
10:54 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki

16:14 <vmassol> reminder: tommorrow is 6.2.1 release date  
16:20 <unfed> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <Enygma`> tmortagne: I just tried to export to XAR a document in the AppWithingMinutes space and I get a lot of these messages in the console:  
16:51 <Enygma`> ...  
16:51 <Enygma`> ... INFO  .i.i.InstanceInputFilterStream - Skipped document [xwiki:AppWithinMinutes.WizardStep]  
16:51 <Enygma`> seems like it's "skipping" all the pages in the space, except the one I`m exporting  
16:52 <Enygma`> is is a known issue?  
16:52 <tmortagne> yes that's how it's working, the only issue here is that you see the log which should not happen  
16:53 <tmortagne> how did you exported ? standard export from the document UR ?  
16:53 <tmortagne> UI  
16:53 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:53 <Enygma`> yes  
16:53 <tmortagne> also what version is this ? 6.3-SNAPSHOT ?  
16:53 <Enygma`> single page xar export from the UI  
16:54 <Enygma`> 6.3 snapshot, but maybe a few days old  
16:54 <vmassol> seems to be new because I haven't noticed this before  
16:54 <tmortagne> did not touched that code since a while so I doubt it would be any different with a more recent snapshot  
16:54 <tmortagne> checking  
16:55 <tmortagne> hmm looks like I forgot to set verbose to false in there  
16:55 <Enygma`> the jars in the lib seem to be build on 19.09.2014 so I guess my instance is 10 days old  
16:56 <tmortagne> ha yes verbose used to be false by default  
16:56 <tmortagne> fixing that  
16:57 <Enygma`> cool  
16:59 <tmortagne> should be ok now  
17:00 <tmortagne> hoping all the logging code is checking the verbose property...
